result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis M. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. - no electronic monitor option.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DNA and Domestic Abuses Surcharges.

Submit DNA sample.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Early discharge if recommended by Agent and successfully completes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis M. Wilson

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

11:40 a.m. Defendant Curtis M. Wilson in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sentence: 18 mo Probation w/conditions as stated.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification was complied with and is not present.
Court reviewed letters of victim.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint recommendation and requests early discharge and states there is 2 days credit. 

BY THE COURT:*******PROBATION***
I/S Sentence:  60 days jail - with huber - no electronic monitor option. - stayed
18 mo Probation:
Conditions: 
Pay costs, DNA and Domestic Abuses Surcharges.
  Submit DNA sample.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Early discharge if recommended by Agent and successfully completes.

Defendant Curtis M. Wilson in court with attorney Atty Renc for Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered
Bond continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
CAP Services Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: A. Wilson - wants contact

$2,000 sig bond: Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Ashley Wilson, her residence, visitation would have to be arranged thru a third party.  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2,000 sig bond  with conditions as stated.  No Ashley Wilson, her residence, or her daughter unless court order is in place.
